contentrichtext.text: {{unsourced|date=February 2010}} [[Image:Jannsen.jpg|frame|Johann Voldemar Jannsen]]'''Johann Voldemar Jannsen''' (May 16, 1819 in [[Vändra]], [[Governorate of Livonia|Livonia]], [[Russian Empire]] – July 13, 1890 in [[Tartu]]) was an [[Estonian literature|Estonian journalist and poet]] active in Livonia. He wrote the words of the [[Estonian people|patriotic song]] "[[Mu isamaa, mu õnn ja rõõm]]", which later became the [[national anthem]] of [[Estonia]]. He was the father of the poet [[Lydia Koidula]]. As the leader of the choral society which organised the first nationwide Song Festival in [[Tartu]] in 1869, Jannsen played a crucial role in the [[Estonian National Awakening]]. [[Image:Johann Voldemar Jannsen grave.JPG|left|thumb|Gravestone in Tartu]] {{Authority control|VIAF=34574621}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Jannsen, Johann Voldemar | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Estonian writer | DATE OF BIRTH = May 16, 1819 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = July 13, 1890 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Jannsen, Johann Voldemar}} [[Category:1819 births]] [[Category:1890 deaths]] [[Category:Estonian journalists]] [[Category:Estonian poets]] [[Category:National anthem writers]] [[Category:People from Pärnu County]] [[Category:People from Pärnu]] [[Category:People from Tartu]] [[Category:19th-century Estonian people]] {{estonia-poet-stub}} {{estonia-journalist-stub}}
